title.narrative: HL4- COMMUNITY HEALTH

description.narrative: By 2021, at least 60 per cent of community structures in targeted districts have adequate technical skills to deliver quality community-based services., which contributes to Evaluation, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Research, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: More children, especially newborns, infants and young children reach their fifth birthday. Pregnant and lactating women, children and adolescents (girls and boys) infected and affected by HIV, particularly the most vulnerable, use holistic and integrated quality management and promotion for behavioral change to improve their survival. Fewer children under 5 suffer from stunting and acute malnutrition.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, at least 60 per cent of community structures in targeted districts have adequate technical skills to deliver qualitycommunity-based services.

description.narrative: En 2021, 235 sites de soins communautaires ont été fonctionnels (contre 190 en 2020) avec 1,845 agents de santé et relais communautaires formés, leurs dotations en matériels et médicaments dans 11 districts des Régions de l’Ouest, du Nord-Ouest et du Centre du pays.; Ainsi 39,269 enfants dont 18,014 filles ont pu être pris en charge pour les maladies courantes de l’enfant. La participation communautaire s’est accrue avec le fonctionnement de 120 cellules d’animation communautaires (aucune en 2020). 105,678 femmes/gardiennes d’enfants de 0-23 mois ont été sensibilisées sur les Pratiques Familiales Essentielle et Alimentation du Nourrisson et du Jeune Enfant. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:25/01/2022

title.narrative: Number of children and women accessing the primary health care in UNICEF-supported facilities, Number
